thread.title: Jordy Nelson knocked out of Giants-Packers playoff game after big sideline hit
thread.title_full: Jordy Nelson knocked out of Giants-Packers playoff game after big sideline hit

author: Christian D'Andrea
title: Jordy Nelson knocked out of Giants-Packers playoff game after big sideline hit
text:
Nelson’s status is uncertain after getting smashed by Leon Hall.
Jordy Nelson left Sunday’s Wild Card game against the Giants after absorbing a massive shot from Giants safety Leon Hall in the second quarter. The pass-separating tackle left Nelson crumpled on the Green Bay sideline, where he was later carted off the field and into the locker room. 
Later, the team reported his return was questionable.
WR Jordy Nelson (rib) is questionable to return #NYGvsGB 
— Green Bay Packers (@packers) January 8, 2017 
Nelson took the clean hit to his ribs and hip and lay prone on the sideline while team trainers attended to him. The incomplete pass was endemic of the Packers’ struggles Sunday. Through 20 minutes of game time, Green Bay had gained only seven total yards.
